alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 7:26PM MDT until June 17 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Forsyth affecting Treasure and Rosebud Counties. Yellowstone River at Miles City affecting Custer County. .Exceptional water levels on the upper reaches of the Yellowstone River will couple with other smaller rivers in the region to cause significant rises over the next 48 to 72 hours. The Yellowstone River is forecast to crest at 11.9 feet at Forsyth, which is 2.1 feet below flood stage of 14 feet. The Yellowstone River is forecast to crest at 13.8 feet at Miles City, which is near flood stage of 14 feet. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Miles City. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yellowstone River Miles City 14.0 10.5 Mon 6 pm 11.6 13.1 13.6 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 130 PM MDT.
